intro: Sabicea duparquetiana, commonly known as the Madagascar hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Sabicea duparquetiana is often found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar.
